Paragraph: In contrast , the polydispersity indices ( PDIs ) showed a very narrow distribution of 1.92 and 1.77 , respectively.

1. Polydispersity indices (PDIs)

These are material properties or indices used to describe the width of the size distribution of particles in a dispersion or polymer system. In this context, PDIs are identified as the material entities with the material properties "narrow distribution" and specific numerical values (1.92 and 1.77).
